examples: "What's wrong with him?" "I'm not really sure."
I know for sure that I won't be able to go to the party.

definitions.definition: to be very or too confident:
examples: She's become much more sure of herself since she got a job.

definitions.definition: be confident that something is true:
examples: He said that he wasn't completely sure of his facts.

definitions.definition: to have confidence in and trust someone:
examples: Henry has only been working for us for a short while, and we're not really sure about him yet.

definitions.definition: to look and/or take action to be certain that something happens, is true, etc.:
examples: Make sure you lock the door when you go out.

definitions.definition: If you have a sure knowledge or understanding of something, you know or understand it very well:
examples: I don't think he has a very sure understanding of the situation.
"Do you want to come swimming with us?" "Sure."

definitions.definition: said when someone has thanked you:
examples: "Thanks for helping us out." "Sure, any time."
